description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vtpg","text":"This protocol describes a plaque assay for the enumeration of phage infecting Microcystis aeruginosa NIES-298.  It is a single agarose layer assay and reproducibly quantifies infection by the Microcystis-infecting phage Ma-LMM01.  This protocol has been adapted from work by Moore et al. (2007) as per Lindell (2014).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":192,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5s1ri","text":"The protocol has been designed to work with cultures / lysates in a laboratory setting.  If phage that will infect this host are present in natural samples, there is no reason the protocol should not detect them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: plaque assay, cyanophage, Microcystis aeruginosa,harmful algal blooms
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"120ha","text":"Microcystis aeruginosa NIES 298 is available from the National Institute for Environmental Studies (Japan)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jgci","text":"Ma-LMM01 was kindly provided by Professor Professor Takashi Yoshida (Kyoto University). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3j2tq","text":"Make 0.56% agarose in CT medium base by adding 0.56 g low melting point agarose / 100 mL CT medium prior to autoclaving. You will need 12 mL of CT agarose per plate. Note: the final agarose concentration in plates will be ~ 0.45% once culture and lysate are added (see below). CT medium is modified from Watanabe and Hiroki, 1997 by adding phosphorus of equal concentrations using sodium phosphate in place of Na2*beta-glycerophosphate.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":412,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"45C4ADA89560477C8711895E91081509","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.iizccf6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4pnft","text":"After autoclaving, place in water bath at  . Add vitamins once agarose has cooled but not solidified. Make 12 mL aliquots and keep each in a water bath  at    until ready to  plate. Alternatively, CT agarose (without vitamins) can be prepared in advance and microwaved prior to the water bath step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":156,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"73A4C1D199D111EE95040A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"34","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3782668799D111EE95040A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"34","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"666ss","text":"Concentrate log-phase M. aeruginosa NIES-298 cells (culture should be no more than 3-4 days old and ~ 1-2 * 106 cells/mL) by centrifugation at 8000 xg for 10 min (x2). The first centrifugation step will collapse the gas vacuoles; the second will form the pellet. Remove excess medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":13},{"style":"sup","offset":110,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iiib","text":"Resuspend cells in fresh CT medium. Cells should be concentrated to ~2-3 * 107 cells/mL. You will need 2 mL of concentrated cells per plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":77,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n0fs","text":"Make a serial dilution of virus containing solution to be tested using CT media. Fresh Ma-LMM01 lysates generally contains ~ 2-6 * 107 pfu/mL, so 10-5 -10-7 dilutions will get plates in the countable range of ~ 20-200 pfu (plaque forming units) per plate.  PFUs outside this range are difficult to quantify accurately. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":133,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":148,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":154,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16jb","text":"Add 1 mL of diluted sample to 2 mL of concentrated cells. For negative controls, add 1 mL of CT medium to 2 mL concentrated cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cpav","text":"Pour the 12 mL aliquot of CT low melt agarose into the plate. Add the 3 mL combination of lysate and cells next to the agarose. Swirl gently to mix together to form one homogenous layer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1eenv","text":"Incubate at    and 30-40 µmols photons m-2 s-1 continuous light. Plates can be flipped on day 2. Plaques should start to become visible ~day 3, and can be counted through day 5. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":40,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":44,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5csmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"26","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsttv","text":"Plates can be carefully moved to an incubator adjusted for Microcystis growth immediately after pouring, or once they are solidified. Note: plates will take 1-2 hours to solidify. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m41q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8te0","text":"Important: unlike standard bacterial plaque assays do not flip plates. Plates will not be firm enough for flipping for at least one day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Plaque Assay for Microcystis aeruginosa NIES-298 and phage Ma-LMM01
title_html: Plaque Assay for Microcystis aeruginosa NIES-298 and phage Ma-LMM01
